intro: Ouratea febrifuga, commonly known as the feverfew tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy surface. The flowers are clustered in terminal panicles and bloom during the rainy season, attracting various pollinators.
